definition: to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat

sentences.english: Watch your language or you'll be spending the weekend in your room.
sentences.chinese: 注意你的用字，否则你这个周末将禁足在家。

sentences.english: My mom thought I told her to say that and grounded me for a month.
sentences.chinese: 我妈认为是我教的，让我禁足一个月。

sentences.english: As the ringleader, you are also grounded for a month.
sentences.chinese: 作为罪魁祸首，你要被禁足一个月。

sentences.english: You will be grounded for two months.
Is it the dog who demonstrates incredible intensity in the holding?
sentences.chinese: 它是指犬在止步禁足时，展示出的难以置信的强度吗？

sentences.english: How four be elder brother's pouring grounding Tong good surname?
sentences.chinese: 怎么四阿哥倒要把佟佳氏禁足了？

sentences.english: He is always grounded by his parents for a week.
sentences.chinese: 他常常被父母禁足一周。

definition: shut oneself up and ponder over one's mistakes
to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
to reflect on one's past errors
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
(in literature and opera) a place to which a monarch banishes a wife or concubine who falls from favor/(fig.) the doghouse/a state of disfavor
lit. to punish a little to prevent a lot (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent large scale repetition
